cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 20 miles N of Great Inagua Island and 535 miles ESE of Miami, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing WNW, then turning NW toward the Florida Keys / South-central Florida peninsula before lifting northward across Georgia and inland portions of the Southeast U.S.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Keys or extreme South-central Florida peninsula

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect for South Carolina coast at this advisory
weather_observation.warning_coast: None in effect for South Carolina coast at this advisory
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Keys northward along the Florida east and west coasts, coastal Georgia, and potentially the South Carolina coast for strong winds, rain and surge
weather_observation.wind: Cumulative 38% chance of sustained 34-kt (39-mph) winds; gusts could exceed 50 kt as the storm’s center tracks inland to the west of Charleston late Monday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Long-fetch onshore flow ahead of Irma could push water levels 2–4 ft above normal tides along the South Carolina coast, especially during high-tide cycles Monday.
weather_observation.rainfall: Projected 3–6 inches with locally higher totals, enough for flash-flooding in low-lying port facilities.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents beginning this weekend; possible tornadic squalls in outer rain bands.
